skill.name: modal
skill.description: Run Python code in the cloud with serverless containers, GPUs, and autoscaling. Use when deploying ML models, running batch processing jobs, scheduling compute-intensive tasks, or serving APIs that require GPU acceleration or dynamic scaling.
skill.summary: Run Python code in the cloud with serverless containers, GPUs, and autoscaling. Use when deploying M...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill describing Modal cloud platform usage. Contains no code that reads credentials, executes hidden commands, or exfiltrates data. All capabilities described are legitimate cloud computing features.

content.value_statement: You need scalable Python compute for ML, batch, or APIs. This skill guides Modal setup, GPU use, autoscaling, and storage patterns.
actual_capabilities: Define Modal images with Python and system dependencies
Create and invoke cloud functions with remote calls
Request specific GPU types and multi GPU setups
Configure CPU, memory, and ephemeral disk resources
Autoscale workloads with map and container limits
Use volumes, secrets, schedules, and web endpoints
limitations: Requires a Modal account and API token
Works with Python and the Modal SDK only
Runs in Modal cloud, not on local hardware
Costs depend on resource usage and time

use_cases.title: Serve GPU inference
use_cases.description: Deploy a text or image model with autoscaling and GPU selection.

use_cases.title: Run batch pipelines
use_cases.description: Process large datasets in parallel with map and volume storage.

use_cases.title: Expose APIs
use_cases.description: Publish secure web endpoints with FastAPI or WSGI apps.

prompt_templates.title: Start a Modal app
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a minimal Modal app that prints a message and explain how to run it.

prompt_templates.title: Schedule a job
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a Modal function scheduled with Cron that writes a report to a volume.

prompt_templates.title: GPU training task
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Modal function that requests two A100 GPUs and sets a one hour timeout.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy a web API
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a Modal FastAPI endpoint for POST requests and include deployment steps.

output_examples.input: Set up a Modal batch job that processes CSV files in parallel
output: Defines a Modal image with pandas and numpy
Creates a function to process one CSV file
Maps the function across a list of file paths
Returns a summary of processed row counts

best_practices: Pin dependencies in image builds for reproducible runs
Use volumes for model weights and shared datasets
Set sensible autoscaling limits to control cost
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in code examples
Running large jobs without timeouts or limits
Using local paths instead of mounted volumes

faq.question: Is this compatible with Windows or macOS?
faq.answer: Yes, Modal CLI and Python SDK work on major OS platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your Modal plan and selected resources.

faq.question: Can it integrate with FastAPI or Flask?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes patterns for ASGI and WSGI apps.

faq.question: Is my data safe in secrets and volumes?
faq.answer: Secrets are encrypted and only available to functions that request them.

faq.question: What should I do if a function times out?
faq.answer: Increase the timeout and verify resource settings.

faq.question: How does Modal compare to local scripts?
faq.answer: Modal adds cloud scaling, GPUs, and scheduling without server setup.
